Real-time Scanning Example

This example demonstrates how to set up and use the real-time scanning feature of the Unlook SDK.

Basic Real-time Scanning

basic_realtime_scanning.py
 1#!/usr/bin/env python3
 2# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
 3
 4from unlook import UnlookClient
 5from unlook.client.realtime_scanner import create_realtime_scanner
 6import time
 7import numpy as np
 8import open3d as o3d
 9
10def main():
11    # Create client with auto-discovery
12    client = UnlookClient(auto_discover=True)
13    print("Starting scanner discovery...")
14    client.start_discovery()
15
16    # Wait for discovery
17    time.sleep(5)
18
19    # Connect to first available scanner
20    scanners = client.get_discovered_scanners()
21    if not scanners:
22        print("No scanners found. Please check that scanner is powered on.")
23        return
24
25    print(f"Connecting to scanner: {scanners[0].name}")
26    client.connect(scanners[0])
27
28    # Create real-time scanner with medium quality
29    scanner = create_realtime_scanner(
30        client=client,
31        quality="medium",  # Options: "fast", "medium", "high", "ultra"
32    )
33
34    # Start scanning
35    print("Starting real-time scanning...")
36    scanner.start()
37
38    # Create Open3D visualizer
39    vis = o3d.visualization.Visualizer()
40    vis.create_window(window_name="Real-time 3D Scanning")
41
42    # Add coordinate frame
43    coord_frame = o3d.geometry.TriangleMesh.create_coordinate_frame(size=50)
44    vis.add_geometry(coord_frame)
45
46    # Create empty point cloud for visualization
47    pcd = o3d.geometry.PointCloud()
48    vis.add_geometry(pcd)
49
50    # Configure view
51    view_control = vis.get_view_control()
52    view_control.set_zoom(0.5)
53    view_control.set_front([0, 0, -1])
54    view_control.set_lookat([0, 0, 0])
55    view_control.set_up([0, -1, 0])
56
57    try:
58        # Main scanning loop
59        scan_count = 0
60        while scan_count < 100:  # Scan 100 frames
61            # Get the latest point cloud
62            point_cloud = scanner.get_current_point_cloud()
63
64            # Update visualization if available
65            if point_cloud is not None and isinstance(point_cloud, o3d.geometry.PointCloud):
66                # Copy the point cloud to avoid modifying the original
67                pcd.points = point_cloud.points
68                pcd.colors = point_cloud.colors
69
70                # Update visualization
71                vis.update_geometry(pcd)
72                vis.poll_events()
73                vis.update_renderer()
74
75                # Get and print statistics
76                fps = scanner.get_fps()
77                scan_count = scanner.get_scan_count()
78                print(f"FPS: {fps:.1f}, Scan count: {scan_count}, Points: {len(point_cloud.points)}")
79
80            # Brief pause to avoid CPU overuse
81            time.sleep(0.01)
82
83    finally:
84        # Always stop scanning and close visualization
85        print("Stopping scanner...")
86        scanner.stop()
87        vis.destroy_window()
88
89        # Disconnect from scanner
90        client.disconnect()
91        print("Disconnected from scanner")
92
93if __name__ == "__main__":
94    main()

Using Focus Check Before Scanning

realtime_scanning_with_focus_check.py
 1#!/usr/bin/env python3
 2# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
 3
 4from unlook import UnlookClient
 5from unlook.client.realtime_scanner import create_realtime_scanner
 6import time
 7import numpy as np
 8
 9def main():
10    # Create client with auto-discovery
11    client = UnlookClient(auto_discover=True)
12    print("Starting scanner discovery...")
13    client.start_discovery()
14
15    # Wait for discovery
16    time.sleep(5)
17
18    # Connect to first available scanner
19    scanners = client.get_discovered_scanners()
20    if not scanners:
21        print("No scanners found. Please check that scanner is powered on.")
22        return
23
24    print(f"Connecting to scanner: {scanners[0].name}")
25    client.connect(scanners[0])
26
27    # Run focus check before scanning
28    print("Checking camera focus...")
29    focus_results, _ = client.camera.check_stereo_focus()
30
31    # Display focus results
32    for camera_id, (score, quality) in focus_results.items():
33        print(f"Camera {camera_id} focus: {score:.2f}, Quality: {quality}")
34
35    # If focus is poor, run interactive focus check
36    poor_focus = any(quality == "poor" for _, quality in focus_results.values())
37    if poor_focus:
38        print("Poor focus detected. Running interactive focus check...")
39        print("Adjust camera focus until both cameras show GOOD or EXCELLENT.")
40        print("Press Ctrl+C to continue when focus is good.")
41
42        # Run interactive focus check
43        try:
44            client.camera.interactive_stereo_focus_check()
45        except KeyboardInterrupt:
46            print("Focus check interrupted. Continuing with scanning.")
47
48    # Create real-time scanner
49    scanner = create_realtime_scanner(
50        client=client,
51        quality="medium",  # Options: "fast", "medium", "high", "ultra"
52    )
53
54    # Start scanning
55    print("Starting real-time scanning...")
56    scanner.start()
57
58    try:
59        # Main scanning loop
60        for _ in range(100):  # Scan for 100 iterations
61            # Get the latest point cloud
62            point_cloud = scanner.get_current_point_cloud()
63
64            # Process point cloud if available
65            if point_cloud is not None:
66                fps = scanner.get_fps()
67                scan_count = scanner.get_scan_count()
68                num_points = len(point_cloud.points) if hasattr(point_cloud, "points") else len(point_cloud)
69                print(f"FPS: {fps:.1f}, Scan count: {scan_count}, Points: {num_points}")
70
71            # Brief pause
72            time.sleep(0.1)
73
74    finally:
75        # Always stop scanning
76        print("Stopping scanner...")
77        scanner.stop()
78
79        # Disconnect from scanner
80        client.disconnect()
81        print("Disconnected from scanner")
82
83if __name__ == "__main__":
84    main()

Running the Examples

To run these examples:

  1. Ensure you have installed all required dependencies:

    pip install -r client-requirements.txt

  2. Connect your Unlook scanner hardware and ensure it’s powered on

  3. Run the example:

    python basic_realtime_scanning.py

    Or with focus checking:

    python realtime_scanning_with_focus_check.py

Example Command-line Tool

For a more comprehensive example with command-line arguments, see the realtime_scanning_example.py script included in the SDK:

# Run with visualization
python unlook/examples/realtime_scanning_example.py --visualize

# Run with focus checking before scanning
python unlook/examples/realtime_scanning_example.py --check-focus

# Focus on a specific region of interest
python unlook/examples/realtime_scanning_example.py --check-focus --focus-roi 640,360,200,200

# High quality scan with recording
python unlook/examples/realtime_scanning_example.py --quality high --record --output scans/my_scan
